pr_title: [Conjure Java Runtime] Part 28: Modernisation and Recovery of Jepsen

timeline.bodyText: Why don't we use UserAgent.Agent.DEFAULT_VERSION anymore?
timeline.author: Jolyon-S

replies.bodyText: I imagine it's slightly more identifiable, but can't think of another reason other than that 🤷‍♂
replies.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: Ah, that's fair, I forgot that existed - changed to that.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: why is this okay? what happens if you make it the same as how it's used in prod?
timeline.author: felixdesouza

replies.bodyText: Is also fine, just that I'm not really a fan of duplicating that logic here, and it seems a bit unpleasant to expose internals of TransactionManagers to simulate that wrapping. Let me know what you think.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: I suppose I'm asking from a perspective of "will jepsen say there's an illegal trace, when really it would never happen in prod"?
replies.author: felixdesouza

timeline.author: felixdesouza

timeline.message: Give certs expiry dates probably long after AtlasDB stops being used.
